result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shaunie Elayne Mackey in court. Defendant states she qualifies but is not eligible for a public defender and received that Friday afternoon. Court reviews with defendant can apply for Court Appointed Attorney. Defendant requests additional time to obtain counsel. Defendant wishes to waive time limits. State in agreement for defendant to seek counsel. Court accepts waiver of time limits and requests preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Shaunie Elayne Mackey
Current: 4252 Stebner Road, Hermantown, MN 55811 United States  (Effective: 07-07-2022)
Prior: 2820 Piedmont Ave Suite B, Duluth, MN 55811
No contact with Walmart stores in Douglas County. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shaunie Elayne Mackey appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Shaunie Elayne Mackey. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $500 cash bail. No contact with Walmart stores. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State indicates that the defendant does not have ties to the county. Defendant's only criminal history is non-criminal traffic offenses. Attorney Reid indicates the defendant does not have a prior criminal history, only petty misdemeanor offenses in MN. Has strong contacts and employment in St. Louis county, MN. Asks court for signature bond or $200 cash bond.

Court orders $1500 signature bond. No contact with Walmart stores in Douglas County. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
